subject: Re: [junit] Re: Are you really using JUnit during your development?
msgSnippet: ... Wow. Maybe it s the wine in the first-class car of this train, but I found this question very strange. Let me try to ask some questions of my own. How can
messageBody:
cliftonccraig wrote:

> how can you think about a test which does not yet exist?

Wow. Maybe it's the wine in the first-class car of this train, but I
found this question very strange. Let me try to ask some questions of my
own.

How can you write a test that you haven't thought about?

How can a test exist if no-one has yet written it?

As a result, how can a test exist before someone has thought about it?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
